title: (x) Martha Stewart book cover - Archer, Surveyor {Patricia}
author: metaw

comments.content:
It seems the slab serif font is called "Archer" and the serif font is "Surveyor" both created by Tobias Frere-Jones ( [http://www.typography.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20061203002747/http:/www.typography.com/)) for Barbara de Wilde, the former art director of Martha Stewart Living. Surveyor (which must be the italics on this cover) is based on old map fonts. See [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20061203002747/http:/www.commarts.com/CA/featype/hoefler/) article.   
   
I couldn't find font showings for either, though. Maybe now that Martha's a bit hard up she'll sell these fonts to us peons to raise some cash.
Don't you think Martha will look stylish in pinstripes? Its a good thing

I for one like the all-orange prison wear, but that might be too street for Martha.   
   
My first job was working for her (then) husband, 20 years ago. She wasn't nice to me. I can't feel too sorry for her.
